page.title: 04Gt.Addington Church.
page.content: The church was built in A.D.833,but the clock was not built at the same time.The present clock is the second one and is painted gold.The church was rebuilt in 1300 and the tower was built in 1350.There is a Norman arch at the front of the porch. Inside,the alabaster figure is Henry Vere in the armour in which he fought at the Battle of Bosworth.The staircase went to the rood screen which was made out of wood.It was probably destroyed after the Reformation. The trees at the back of the church are horsechestnut,sycamore,oak,holly and alder.At the end of the summer thousands of conkers fall on the ground.At the front of the church there are no trees but 40 graves.The church has 6 bells which are rung regularly.In 1985 the boundary wall was repaired.
